mscVrIpBgpRowStatusTable.name: mscVrIpBgpRowStatusTable
mscVrIpBgpRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscVrIpBgp components.

mscVrIpBgpRowStatusEntry.name: mscVrIpBgpRowStatusEntry
mscVrIpBgpRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscVrIpBgp component.

mscVrIpBgpRowStatus.name: mscVrIpBgpRowStatus
mscVrIpBgpRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscVrIpBgp components. These components can be added and deleted.

mscVrIpBgpComponentName.name: mscVrIpBgpComponentName
mscVrIpBgpComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscVrIpBgpStorageType.name: mscVrIpBgpStorageType
mscVrIpBgpStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscVrIpBgp tables.

mscVrIpBgpIndex.name: mscVrIpBgpIndex
mscVrIpBgpIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscVrIpBgp tables.

mscVrIpBgpProvTable.name: mscVrIpBgpProvTable
mscVrIpBgpProvTable.description: This group contains the provisionable attributes for the Bgp component.

mscVrIpBgpBgpIdentifier.name: mscVrIpBgpBgpIdentifier
mscVrIpBgpBgpIdentifier.description: This attribute specifies the Bgp Identifier of this Bgp component instance. It is picked from the IP address space, and should follow the same rule as choosing an unique IP address for IpPort.

mscVrIpBgpLocalAs.name: mscVrIpBgpLocalAs
mscVrIpBgpLocalAs.description: This attribute specifies the autonomous system identifier for this Bgp component instance.

mscVrIpBgpDefaultLocalPreference.name: mscVrIpBgpDefaultLocalPreference
mscVrIpBgpDefaultLocalPreference.description: This attribute specifies this Bgp component instance's default degree of preference for routes. It can be overridden by the localPreference provisioned in ImportPolicy. A higher value indicates a more preferred route.

mscVrIpBgpDefaultMultiExitDisc.name: mscVrIpBgpDefaultMultiExitDisc
mscVrIpBgpDefaultMultiExitDisc.description: This attribute specifies this Bgp component instance's default metric to discriminate between multiple exit points to the same adjacent autonomous system. It can be overridden by the sendMultiExitDiscToEbgp provisioned in ExportPolicy. A lower value indicates a more preferred route.

mscVrIpBgpRouteThrottleLimit.name: mscVrIpBgpRouteThrottleLimit
mscVrIpBgpRouteThrottleLimit.description: This attribute specifies the maximum number of routes in the IP forwarding table this Bgp component instance will process at one time to decide if a route in the IP forwarding table should be exported to a peer. This limit is used for the throttling and is made configurable because the throttling requirements will be different under different network configurations. The default value is 250.

mscVrIpBgpRouteThrottleInter.name: mscVrIpBgpRouteThrottleInter
mscVrIpBgpRouteThrottleInter.description: This attribute specifies the interval in seconds, between the processing of the routes in the IP forwarding table to decide if a route in the IP forwarding table should be exported to a peer. This interval is used for the throttling and is made configurable because the throttling requirements will be different under different network configurations. The default value is 5 seconds.

mscVrIpBgpRouteReflector.name: mscVrIpBgpRouteReflector
mscVrIpBgpRouteReflector.description: This attribute specifies whether this Bgp instance is a Route Reflector. If the value of this attribute is true, Bgp redistributes routes it learns from an IBGP speaker to other IBGP speakers in the AS. The rule of redistribution depends on the peer type: 1) When a route is learned from a non-client peer, it is redistributed to all the client peers within the cluster. 2) When a route is learned from a client peer, it is redistributed to all the non-client peers and also to the client peers. If the value of this attribute is false, Bgp does not redistribute routes it learns from one IBGP speaker to other IBGP speakers in the AS.

mscVrIpBgpRouteReflectorCluster.name: mscVrIpBgpRouteReflectorCluster
mscVrIpBgpRouteReflectorCluster.description: This attribute identifies the cluster consisting of the Route Reflector and its peer clients. When routeReflector of Bgp is true, value of 0.0.0.0 or 255.255.255.255 is invalid; the default value of this attribute is same as bgpIdentifier. For redundancy, a cluster may have more than one Route Reflector; in this case, the value of this attribute of all the Route Reflectors in the same cluster should be same. The value of this attribute is ignored when routeReflector of Bgp is false

mscVrIpBgpRedistributeIgpToIbgp.name: mscVrIpBgpRedistributeIgpToIbgp
mscVrIpBgpRedistributeIgpToIbgp.description: This attribute specifies whether this Bgp instance allows exporting of IGP routes to internal Bgp peers. IGP routes include the routes learned from OSPF, RIP, local routes and static routes. If the value of this attribute is true, and if ExportPolicy is specified to distribute, then Bgp allows IGP route to be distributed to internal Bgp peers. If the value of this attribute is false, Bgp does not allow IGP routes to be distributed to internal Bgp peer, even if ExportPolicy is specified to distribute. This attribute is set to true if and only this Bgp is part of the Carrier Manage Service, otherwise, a routing loop may result.

mscVrIpBgpOperTable.name: mscVrIpBgpOperTable
mscVrIpBgpOperTable.description: This group contains the operational attributes for the Bgp component.

mscVrIpBgpTableVersion.name: mscVrIpBgpTableVersion
mscVrIpBgpTableVersion.description: This attribute indicates the version of the BGP routing table. It is incremented every time the BGP routing table changes. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpInMsgs.name: mscVrIpBgpInMsgs
mscVrIpBgpInMsgs.description: This attribute counts the total number of BGP messages received without error. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpInErrors.name: mscVrIpBgpInErrors
mscVrIpBgpInErrors.description: This attribute counts the total number of BGP messages received from all peers that proved to be in error. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpInErrorMsgs.name: mscVrIpBgpInErrorMsgs
mscVrIpBgpInErrorMsgs.description: This attribute counts the total number of BGP NOTIFICATION messages from all the peers. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpOutMsgs.name: mscVrIpBgpOutMsgs
mscVrIpBgpOutMsgs.description: This attribute counts the total number of BGP messages sent to peers. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpOutDiscards.name: mscVrIpBgpOutDiscards
mscVrIpBgpOutDiscards.description: This attribute counts the number of BGP messages that were locally generated but were not sent out due to resource limitations within a Bgp instance. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpOutErrorMsgs.name: mscVrIpBgpOutErrorMsgs
mscVrIpBgpOutErrorMsgs.description: This attribute counts the BGP NOTIFICATION messages sent to the peers. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpIndbSize.name: mscVrIpBgpIndbSize
mscVrIpBgpIndbSize.description: This attribute indicates the number of Bgp indb entries under this Bgp component instance.

mscVrIpBgpStateTable.name: mscVrIpBgpStateTable
mscVrIpBgpStateTable.description: This group contains the three OSI State attributes. The descriptions generically indicate what each state attribute implies about the component. Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

mscVrIpBgpAdminState.name: mscVrIpBgpAdminState
mscVrIpBgpAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

mscVrIpBgpOperationalState.name: mscVrIpBgpOperationalState
mscVrIpBgpOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

mscVrIpBgpUsageState.name: mscVrIpBgpUsageState
mscVrIpBgpUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

mscVrIpBgpAdminControlTable.name: mscVrIpBgpAdminControlTable
mscVrIpBgpAdminControlTable.description: This group includes the Administrative Control attribute. This attribute defines the current administrative state of this component.

mscVrIpBgpSnmpAdminStatus.name: mscVrIpBgpSnmpAdminStatus
mscVrIpBgpSnmpAdminStatus.description: The desired state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and packet forwarding is allowed. The down state indicates the interface is not operational and packet forwarding is unavailable. The testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

mscVrIpBgpOperStatusTable.name: mscVrIpBgpOperStatusTable
mscVrIpBgpOperStatusTable.description: This group includes the Operational Status attribute. This attribute defines the current operational state of this component.

mscVrIpBgpSnmpOperStatus.name: mscVrIpBgpSnmpOperStatus
mscVrIpBgpSnmpOperStatus.description: The current state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and capable of forwarding packets. The down state indicates the interface is not operational, thus unable to forward packets. testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

mscVrIpBgpPeerRowStatusTable.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerRowStatusTable
mscVrIpBgpPeerRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscVrIpBgpPeer components.

mscVrIpBgpPeerRowStatusEntry.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerRowStatusEntry
mscVrIpBgpPeerRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscVrIpBgpPeer component.

mscVrIpBgpPeerRowStatus.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerRowStatus
mscVrIpBgpPeerRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscVrIpBgpPeer components. These components can be added and deleted.

mscVrIpBgpPeerComponentName.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerComponentName
mscVrIpBgpPeerComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscVrIpBgpPeerStorageType.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerStorageType
mscVrIpBgpPeerStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscVrIpBgpPeer tables.

mscVrIpBgpPeerPeerAddressIndex.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerPeerAddressIndex
mscVrIpBgpPeerPeerAddressIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscVrIpBgpPeer tables.

mscVrIpBgpPeerProvTable.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerProvTable
mscVrIpBgpPeerProvTable.description: This group contains the provisionable attributes for this BGP Peer component

mscVrIpBgpPeerPeerAs.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerPeerAs
mscVrIpBgpPeerPeerAs.description: This attribute specifies the autonomous system identifier of this BGP Peer component. It will be used to verify the autonomous system identifier learned from the peer through the OPEN message. The peer connection will be rejected and a NOTIFICATION message will be sent to the peer if these two numbers don't match.

mscVrIpBgpPeerLocalAddressConfigured.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerLocalAddressConfigured
mscVrIpBgpPeerLocalAddressConfigured.description: This attribute specifies the local IP address configured for this Bgp Peer connection. If this attribute is 0.0.0.0, TCP will choose a local IP interface based on the remote IP address of this peer connection and the IP forwarding table. The value chosen is stored in the localAddressUsed attribute under the same Peer component.

mscVrIpBgpPeerKeepAliveConfigured.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerKeepAliveConfigured
mscVrIpBgpPeerKeepAliveConfigured.description: This attribute specifies the configured interval in seconds, between BGP KEEPALIVE message retransmissions. It is used to establish the ratio between keepalive interval and hold time. If this attribute is zero, then the holdTimeConfigured attribute should also be zero, which means that periodic KEEPALIVE messages will not be sent.

mscVrIpBgpPeerHoldTimeConfigured.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerHoldTimeConfigured
mscVrIpBgpPeerHoldTimeConfigured.description: This attribute specifies the maximum time in seconds, that may elapse without receiving a KEEPALIVE or UPDATE message before the connection is considered down. The hold time must be either zero or at least three seconds. If this attribute is zero, then the keepAliveConfigured attribute should also be zero, which means that periodic KEEPALIVE messages will not be sent.

mscVrIpBgpPeerConnectRetryTime.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerConnectRetryTime
mscVrIpBgpPeerConnectRetryTime.description: This attribute specifies the time interval in seconds for the ConnectRetry timer. It is the minimum amount of time that must elapse between successive TCP connection retries for establishing BGP peer connection.

mscVrIpBgpPeerMinAsOrigTime.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerMinAsOrigTime
mscVrIpBgpPeerMinAsOrigTime.description: This attribute specifies the time interval in seconds for the MinAsOriginationInterval timer. It is the minimum amount of time that must elapse between updates that advertise a change to a route within the local autonomous system to neighboring autonomous systems.

mscVrIpBgpPeerMinRouteAdvTime.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerMinRouteAdvTime
mscVrIpBgpPeerMinRouteAdvTime.description: This attribute specifies the time interval in seconds for the MinRouteAdvertisementInterval timer. Feasible routes received from peers in other autonomous systems may only be re-advertised to peers in other autonomous systems at a rate no greater than MinRouteAdvertisementInterval.

mscVrIpBgpPeerDefaultInAggMed.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerDefaultInAggMed
mscVrIpBgpPeerDefaultInAggMed.description: This attribute specifies this Bgp Peer component instance's metric for generating a dynamic default route whenever this external bgp peer got established. It is used to prioritize between the dynamic default routes generated by Passport Bgp speakers. If this attribute is not set, Bgp will not generate a dynamic default route. If this attribute is set, Bgp will automatically generate a dynamic default route when the connection established.

mscVrIpBgpPeerIsRouteReflectorClient.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerIsRouteReflectorClient
mscVrIpBgpPeerIsRouteReflectorClient.description: This attribute specifies whether the peer is a client peer or non- client peer of this Bgp instance. The attribute is only meaningful if attribute routeReflector of Bgp is true.

mscVrIpBgpPeerRemovePrivateAs.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerRemovePrivateAs
mscVrIpBgpPeerRemovePrivateAs.description: This attribute specifies the treatment of the AS_PATH path attribute in routes sent to the peer. If this attribute is enabled, then BGP will remove private AS numbers from the AS_PATH. This attribute is meaningful only for external peers.

mscVrIpBgpPeerStateTable.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerStateTable
mscVrIpBgpPeerStateTable.description: This group contains the three OSI State attributes. The descriptions generically indicate what each state attribute implies about the component. Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

mscVrIpBgpPeerAdminState.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerAdminState
mscVrIpBgpPeerAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

mscVrIpBgpPeerOperationalState.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerOperationalState
mscVrIpBgpPeerOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

mscVrIpBgpPeerUsageState.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerUsageState
mscVrIpBgpPeerUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

mscVrIpBgpPeerOperTable.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerOperTable
mscVrIpBgpPeerOperTable.description: This group contains the operational attributes for the Peer component.

mscVrIpBgpPeerConnectionState.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerConnectionState
mscVrIpBgpPeerConnectionState.description: This attribute indicates the current state of this BGP peer connection. The meaning of each state is as follows: idle - it is the initial state of the BGP peer connection. Error events will also cause BGP peer connection to transit to the idle state. connect - BGP has initiated a TCP connection request to this peer, and waiting for reply from that peer. active - BGP is not initiating a TCP connection request to this peer, because TCP connection failed and is waiting for connection retry time-out. openSent - a TCP connection to this peer has been established, but the OPEN message has not been successfully exchanged. openConfirm - OPEN message has been successfully exchanged with this peer, but the first KEEPALIVE message has not been received from that peer. established - the first KEEPALIVE message has been received from this peer, which means this BGP peer connection has been established. See RFC 1771 for a detailed description of BGP state transitions.

mscVrIpBgpPeerBgpIdentifier.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerBgpIdentifier
mscVrIpBgpPeerBgpIdentifier.description: This attribute indicates the BGP Identifier of this Bgp Peer component. It is learned from the peer through the OPEN message.

mscVrIpBgpPeerVersionNegotiated.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerVersionNegotiated
mscVrIpBgpPeerVersionNegotiated.description: This attribute indicates the BGP version number negotiated with this peer through the OPEN message. Currently, only BGP version 4 is supported. BGP will reject the peer connection if our peer proposes a BGP version other than 4.

mscVrIpBgpPeerHoldTimeNegotiated.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerHoldTimeNegotiated
mscVrIpBgpPeerHoldTimeNegotiated.description: This attribute indicates the maximum time in seconds, that may elapse without receiving a KEEPALIVE or UPDATE message before the connection is considered down. This is the negotiated value with peer through the OPEN message. The hold time must be either zero or at least three seconds. If the negotiated hold time is zero, then periodic KEEPALIVE messages are not expected from the peer.

mscVrIpBgpPeerKeepAliveNegotiated.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerKeepAliveNegotiated
mscVrIpBgpPeerKeepAliveNegotiated.description: This attribute indicates the interval in seconds, between BGP KEEPALIVE message retransmissions. This keepalive interval will have the same ratio to the hold time negotiated with the peer as that of the locally configured keepalive and hold time. This attribute will be zero if the holdTimeNegotiated attribute is zero, which means periodic KEEPALIVE messages will not be sent.

mscVrIpBgpPeerLocalAddressUsed.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerLocalAddressUsed
mscVrIpBgpPeerLocalAddressUsed.description: This attribute indicates the local IP address used for this BGP peer connection. If the localAddressConfigured attribute is non-zero, its value will be used. Otherwise, the local address will be assigned by TCP based on the remote IP address of this peer connection and the IP forwarding table.

mscVrIpBgpPeerLocalPort.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerLocalPort
mscVrIpBgpPeerLocalPort.description: This attribute indicates the local TCP port for the connection between the BGP peers.

mscVrIpBgpPeerRemotePort.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerRemotePort
mscVrIpBgpPeerRemotePort.description: This attribute indicates the remote TCP port for the connection between the BGP peers.

mscVrIpBgpPeerLastError.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerLastError
mscVrIpBgpPeerLastError.description: This attribute indicates the last error code and subcode seen by this Bgp component instance on this peer connection. The first byte of this two byte OCTET STRING contains the error code, and the second byte contains the subcode. A value of zero means that no error has occurred. Check RFC 1771 for mappings of error codes and error subcodes.

mscVrIpBgpPeerConnectionEstablishedTime.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerConnectionEstablishedTime
mscVrIpBgpPeerConnectionEstablishedTime.description: This attribute indicates how long since this Peer component's last transition to or from the established state. It is set to zero when the Peer component is activated. DESCRIPTION

mscVrIpBgpPeerConnectionEstablishedTrans.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerConnectionEstablishedTransitions
mscVrIpBgpPeerConnectionEstablishedTrans.description: This attribute counts the total number of times the BGP connection state transitioned into the established state.

mscVrIpBgpPeerInUpdateElapsedTime.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerInUpdateElapsedTime
mscVrIpBgpPeerInUpdateElapsedTime.description: This attribute indicates the elapsed time in seconds since the last BGP UPDATE message was received from the peer. Each time inUpdates attribute is incremented, the value of this attribute is set to zero.

mscVrIpBgpPeerInMsgs.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerInMsgs
mscVrIpBgpPeerInMsgs.description: This attribute counts the number of BGP messages received without error from the BGP peer. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpPeerInUpdates.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerInUpdates
mscVrIpBgpPeerInUpdates.description: This attribute counts the number of BGP UPDATE messages received on this peer connection. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpPeerInErrors.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerInErrors
mscVrIpBgpPeerInErrors.description: This attribute counts the number of messages received from this BGP peer that proved to be in error. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpPeerInErrorMsgs.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerInErrorMsgs
mscVrIpBgpPeerInErrorMsgs.description: This attribute counts the number of BGP NOTIFICATION messages received from this BGP peer. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpPeerOutMsgs.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerOutMsgs
mscVrIpBgpPeerOutMsgs.description: This attribute counts the number of locally generated BGP messages sent to this BGP peer. It does not include discarded messages. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpPeerOutUpdates.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerOutUpdates
mscVrIpBgpPeerOutUpdates.description: This attribute counts the number of BGP UPDATE messages sent to this peer. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpPeerOutDiscards.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerOutDiscards
mscVrIpBgpPeerOutDiscards.description: This attribute counts the number of locally generated BGP messages not sent to this BGP peer due to resource limitations within a BGP entity. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpPeerOutErrorMsgs.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerOutErrorMsgs
mscVrIpBgpPeerOutErrorMsgs.description: This attribute counts the number of BGP NOTIFICATION messages sent to this BGP peer. This counter will wrap to zero once the value exceeds the maximum value.

mscVrIpBgpPeerInRoutes.name: mscVrIpBgpPeerInRoutes
mscVrIpBgpPeerInRoutes.description: This attribute indicates the number of routes received from this BGP peer.

mscVrIpBgpImportRowStatusTable.name: mscVrIpBgpImportRowStatusTable
mscVrIpBgpImportRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscVrIpBgpImport components.

mscVrIpBgpImportRowStatusEntry.name: mscVrIpBgpImportRowStatusEntry
mscVrIpBgpImportRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscVrIpBgpImport component.

mscVrIpBgpImportRowStatus.name: mscVrIpBgpImportRowStatus
mscVrIpBgpImportRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscVrIpBgpImport components. These components can be added and deleted.

mscVrIpBgpImportComponentName.name: mscVrIpBgpImportComponentName
mscVrIpBgpImportComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscVrIpBgpImportStorageType.name: mscVrIpBgpImportStorageType
mscVrIpBgpImportStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscVrIpBgpImport tables.

mscVrIpBgpImportIndex.name: mscVrIpBgpImportIndex
mscVrIpBgpImportIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscVrIpBgpImport tables.

mscVrIpBgpImportProvTable.name: mscVrIpBgpImportProvTable
mscVrIpBgpImportProvTable.description: This group contains all the provisionable attributes for the Import component.

mscVrIpBgpImportPeerAs.name: mscVrIpBgpImportPeerAs
mscVrIpBgpImportPeerAs.description: This key attribute specifies the autonomous system number of the peer from which the routes are learned. A value of 0 for this attribute means that peer AS number will match any AS number.

mscVrIpBgpImportPeerIpAddress.name: mscVrIpBgpImportPeerIpAddress
mscVrIpBgpImportPeerIpAddress.description: This key attribute specifies the IP address of the peer from which the routes are learned. A value of 0.0.0.0 for this attribute means that peer IP address will match any IP address.

mscVrIpBgpImportOriginAs.name: mscVrIpBgpImportOriginAs
mscVrIpBgpImportOriginAs.description: This key attribute specifies the autonomous system number where the routes were originated. A value of 0 for this attribute means origin AS number will match any AS number.

mscVrIpBgpImportOriginProtocol.name: mscVrIpBgpImportOriginProtocol
mscVrIpBgpImportOriginProtocol.description: This key attribute specifies the protocols that originated the routes. A value of incomplete for this attribute means this information is not available.

mscVrIpBgpImportUsageFlag.name: mscVrIpBgpImportUsageFlag
mscVrIpBgpImportUsageFlag.description: This attribute specifies whether BGP will use or ignore information in received update if it meets criteria specified by the key attributes of this component.

mscVrIpBgpImportLocalPreference.name: mscVrIpBgpImportLocalPreference
mscVrIpBgpImportLocalPreference.description: This attribute specifies this Bgp component instance's degree of preference for those routes that match the criteria of this import policy. A higher value indicates a more preferred route. A value of 0 for this attribute means that the default local preference value provisioned under the Bgp component should be used.

mscVrIpBgpImportPreferredOver.name: mscVrIpBgpImportPreferredOver
mscVrIpBgpImportPreferredOver.description: This attribute indicates the preference of the external BGP route with the OSPF internal route. overIntOspf means that the external BGP route is chosen over OSPF internal route, while underIntOspf means that the OSPF internal route is chosen over the external BGP route. The default preference is set to underIntOspf.

mscVrIpBgpImportAsPathExpression.name: mscVrIpBgpImportAsPathExpression
mscVrIpBgpImportAsPathExpression.description: This key attribute allows the user to enter a regular expression to match the import AS Path Attribute of the received update message. Note: the AS Path Attribute lists the ASs in reverse traversal order. The syntax of the regular expression is a subset of the RFC 2280. The basic syntax of a regular expression is a list of AS number separated by a space which making up a AS path. The following characters has the special meaning: '.' - Matches any AS number. '^n' - Matches the first AS item (n) in the AS Path Attribute, or in order words, matches the last AS (n) traversed in the AS path. 'n$' - Matches the last AS item (n) in the AS Path Attribute, or in order words, matches the first AS (n) traversed in the AS path. '[n1 ... n2]' - Matches any AS number that appeared in the set n1 ... n2. 'n1 - n2' - Matches any AS number between the range of n1 and n2. '()' - is supported to change the order of evaluation. 'n*' - Matches 0 or more occurrences of n, where n can be a set, range or AS number. 'n+' - Matches 1 or more occurrences of n, where n can be a set, range or AS number. 'n?' - Matches 0 or 1 occurrences of n, where n can be a AS set, range or number. The following logical operators are evaluated in decending order: 'NOT' - Given a regular expression x, NOT x matches the AS number pattern that is not matched by x. 'AND' - Given two regular expressions x and y, x AND y matches the intersection of the AS path that are matched by x and those are matched by y. 'OR' - Given two regular expressions x and y, x OR y matches the union of the AS path that are matched by x and those are matched by y. For example: The AS path '5 4 3 2 1', where 1 is the origin AS, would be match by any one of the following regular expressions: 1$, ^5, 4 3, 5 3 - 4*, 5 [4 3 2] not10 2 1, not (6 7 8 9 10) and 5 4 .* 1 Empty regular expression implies a match on all AS path.

mscVrIpBgpImportCommunityExpression.name: mscVrIpBgpImportCommunityExpression
mscVrIpBgpImportCommunityExpression.description: This key attribute allows the user to enter a regular expression to match the import Community Attribute of the received update message. The syntax of the regular expression is a subset of the RFC 2280. The basic syntax of a regular expression is a list of Community number seperated by a space which making up a Community attribute. The following characters has the special meaning: '[n1 ... n2]' - Matches any Community number that appeared in the set n1 ... n2. 'n1 - n2' - Matches any Community number between the range of n1 and n2. '()' - is supported to change the order of evaluation. 'n*' - Matches 0 or more occurrences of n, where n can be a set, range or Community number. 'n+' - Matches 1 or more occurrences of n, where n can be a set, range or Community number. 'n?' - Matches 0 or 1 occurrences of n, where n can be a set, range or number. The following logical operators are evaluated in decending order: 'NOT' - Given a regular expression x, NOT x matches the Community attribute that is not matched by x. 'AND' - Given two regular expressions x and y, x AND y matches the intersection of the Community attribute that are matched by x and those are matched by y. 'OR' - Given two regular expressions x and y, x OR y matches the union of the Community attribute that are matched by x and those are matched by y. For example: The Community path '1 2 3 4 5' would be match by any one of the following regular expression: 1, 5, 4 3, 2 3 - 4*, 1 [3 4 2]+, not (6 7 8 9 10) and 1 2 Empty regular expression implies a match on all Community path.

mscVrIpBgpImportExpressPreference.name: mscVrIpBgpImportExpressPreference
mscVrIpBgpImportExpressPreference.description: This attribute specifies the relative preference of the policy which use the keys expressAsPath and expressCommunity. This attribute is ignored if attributes expressAsPath and expressCommunity are both empty. This attribute is used to break the tie when two import policies' expression attributes match a specific AS Path or Community. A higher value indicates a more preferred policy.

mscVrIpBgpImportAppendCommunity.name: mscVrIpBgpImportAppendCommunity
mscVrIpBgpImportAppendCommunity.description: This attribute indicates which community number this Import policy will send along with the Path Attribute. Refer to RFC 1997 for the detailed description of how this attribute may be used to pass additional information to BGP peers. If the value is set to 0, no community is appended to the Community attribute.

mscVrIpBgpImportNetRowStatusTable.name: mscVrIpBgpImportNetRowStatusTable
mscVrIpBgpImportNetRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscVrIpBgpImportNet components.

mscVrIpBgpImportNetRowStatusEntry.name: mscVrIpBgpImportNetRowStatusEntry
mscVrIpBgpImportNetRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscVrIpBgpImportNet component.

mscVrIpBgpImportNetRowStatus.name: mscVrIpBgpImportNetRowStatus
mscVrIpBgpImportNetRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscVrIpBgpImportNet components. These components can be added and deleted.

mscVrIpBgpImportNetComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscVrIpBgpImportNetIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscVrIpBgpImportNet tables.

mscVrIpBgpImportNetProvTable.description: This group contains the set of provisionable attributes for the Network component.

mscVrIpBgpImportNetPrefix.description: This attribute specifies the network prefix whose length is determined by the length attribute under the same Network component.

mscVrIpBgpImportNetLength.name: mscVrIpBgpImportNetLength
mscVrIpBgpImportNetLength.description: This attribute specifies the length of the network prefix.

mscVrIpBgpExportRowStatusTable.name: mscVrIpBgpExportRowStatusTable
mscVrIpBgpExportRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscVrIpBgpExport components.

mscVrIpBgpExportRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscVrIpBgpExport component.

mscVrIpBgpExportRowStatus.name: mscVrIpBgpExportRowStatus
mscVrIpBgpExportRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscVrIpBgpExport components. These components can be added and deleted.

mscVrIpBgpExportComponentName.name: mscVrIpBgpExportComponentName
mscVrIpBgpExportComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscVrIpBgpExportStorageType.name: mscVrIpBgpExportStorageType
mscVrIpBgpExportStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscVrIpBgpExport tables.

mscVrIpBgpExportIndex.name: mscVrIpBgpExportIndex
mscVrIpBgpExportIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscVrIpBgpExport tables.

mscVrIpBgpExportProvTable.name: mscVrIpBgpExportProvTable
mscVrIpBgpExportProvTable.description: This group contains all the provisioned attributes for the Export component.

mscVrIpBgpExportPeerAs.name: mscVrIpBgpExportPeerAs
mscVrIpBgpExportPeerAs.description: This key attribute specifies the autonomous system number of the peer where the routes are advertised to. A value of 0 for this attribute means this export policy applies to all peer ASes.

mscVrIpBgpExportPeerIpAddress.name: mscVrIpBgpExportPeerIpAddress
mscVrIpBgpExportPeerIpAddress.description: This key attribute specifies the IP address of the peer where the routes are advertised to. A value of 0.0.0.0 for this attribute means this export policy applies to all peers.

mscVrIpBgpExportProtocol.name: mscVrIpBgpExportProtocol
mscVrIpBgpExportProtocol.description: This key attribute specifies which protocol the export policy applies to. If it is set to all, that means this export policy will apply all routes in the IP routing table. Example: vr/1 ip ospf export/1 with advertise Status = block protocol = bgpExternal bgpAsId = 3 peerAs = 5 This policy specifies that all routes learned from EBGP Peers that are originated from AS 3 should not be advertised to AS 5.

mscVrIpBgpExportEgpAsId.name: mscVrIpBgpExportEgpAsId
mscVrIpBgpExportEgpAsId.description: This key attribute specifies the EGP autonomous system number that this export policy will apply to. When this value is non-zero, the protocol attribute must be set to egp.

mscVrIpBgpExportBgpAsId.name: mscVrIpBgpExportBgpAsId
mscVrIpBgpExportBgpAsId.description: This key attribute specifies the BGP autonomous system number that this export policy will apply to. When this value is non-zero, the protocol attribute must be set to either bgpInternal or bgpExternal.

mscVrIpBgpExportOspfTag.name: mscVrIpBgpExportOspfTag
mscVrIpBgpExportOspfTag.description: This key attribute specifies the OSPF tag when the protocol attribute is set to either ospfInternal or ospfExternal. The default tag value 4294967295 (FFFFFFFF in hex) indicates that the tag not specified.

mscVrIpBgpExportRipInterface.name: mscVrIpBgpExportRipInterface
mscVrIpBgpExportRipInterface.description: This key attribute specifies the local RIP interface where the routes are learned from. The ripInterface attribute when non-zero should be equal to one of the IP addresses provisioned as a logicalIf component under IpPort. Otherwise, this policy will be ignored. The value of the protocol attribute must be set to rip if a value for the ripInterface attribute is non-zero.

mscVrIpBgpExportRipNeighbor.name: mscVrIpBgpExportRipNeighbor
mscVrIpBgpExportRipNeighbor.description: This key attribute specifies the RIP neighbor where the routes were learned from. The value of the protocol attribute must be set to rip if a value for the ripNeighbor attribute is non-zero.

mscVrIpBgpExportAdvertiseStatus.name: mscVrIpBgpExportAdvertiseStatus
mscVrIpBgpExportAdvertiseStatus.description: This attribute specifies whether data will be exported if it meets criteria specified by the other key attributes of this component.

mscVrIpBgpExportMultiExitDisc.name: mscVrIpBgpExportMultiExitDisc
mscVrIpBgpExportMultiExitDisc.description: This attribute specifies this Bgp component instance's metric to discriminate between multiple exit points to an adjacent autonomous system if the route meets the criteria specified by the key attributes of this component. A lower value indicates a more preferred route. A value of 0 for this attribute means the default MED value provisioned under the Bgp component should be used.

mscVrIpBgpExportSendMultiExitDiscToEbgp.name: mscVrIpBgpExportSendMultiExitDiscToEbgp
mscVrIpBgpExportSendMultiExitDiscToEbgp.description: This attribute specifies whether the Multi Exit Discriminator(MED) attribute should be included in an update message sent to an EBGP peer.

mscVrIpBgpExportAsPathExpression.name: mscVrIpBgpExportAsPathExpression
mscVrIpBgpExportAsPathExpression.description: This key attribute allows the user to enter a regular expression to match the import AS Path Attribute of the export update message. Note: the AS Path Attribute lists the ASs in reverse traversal order. The syntax of the regular expression is a subset of the RFC 2280. The basic syntax of a regular expression is a list of AS number separated by a space which making up a AS path. The following characters has the special meaning: '.' - Matches any AS number. '^n' - Matches the first AS item (n) in the AS Path Attribute, or in order words, matches the last AS (n) traversed in the AS path. 'n$' - Matches the last AS item (n) in the AS Path Attribute, or in order words, matches the first AS (n) traversed in the AS path. '[n1 ... n2]' - Matches any AS number that appeared in the set n1 ... n2. 'n1 - n2' - Matches any AS number between the range of n1 and n2. '()' - is supported to change the order of evaluation. 'n*' - Matches 0 or more occurrences of n, where n can be a set, range or AS number. 'n+' - Matches 1 or more occurrences of n, where n can be a set, range or AS number. 'n?' - Matches 0 or 1 occurrences of n, where n can be a set, range or number. The following logical operators are evaluated in decending order: 'NOT' - Given a regular expression x, NOT x matches the AS number pattern that is not matched by x. 'AND' - Given two regular expressions x and y, x AND y matches the intersection of the AS path that are matched by x and those are matched by y. 'OR' - Given two regular expressions x and y, x OR y matches the union of the AS path that are matched by x and those are matched by y. For example: The AS path '5 4 3 2 1', where 1 is the origin AS, would be match by any one of the following regular expressions: 1$, ^5, 4 3, 5 3 - 4*, 5 [4 3 2] not10 2 1, not (6 7 8 9 10) and 5 4 .* 1 Empty regular expression implies a match on all AS path.

mscVrIpBgpExportCommunityExpression.name: mscVrIpBgpExportCommunityExpression
mscVrIpBgpExportCommunityExpression.description: This key attribute allows the user to enter a regular expression to match the import Community Attribute of the received update message. The syntax of the regular expression is a subset of the RFC 2280. The basic syntax of a regular expression is a list of Community number seperated by a space which making up a Community attribute. The following characters has the special meaning: '[n1 ... n2]' - Matches any Community number that appeared in the set n1 ... n2. 'n1 - n2' - Matches any Community number between the range of n1 and n2. '()' - is supported to change the order of evaluation. 'n*' - Matches 0 or more occurrences of n, where n can be a set, range or Community number. 'n+' - Matches 1 or more occurrences of n, where n can be a set, range or Community number. 'n?' - Matches 0 or 1 occurrences of n, where n can be a set, range or number. The following logical operators are evaluated in decending order: 'NOT' - Given a regular expression x, NOT x matches the Community attribute that is not matched by x. 'AND' - Given two regular expressions x and y, x AND y matches the intersection of the Community attribute that are matched by x and those are matched by y. 'OR' - Given two regular expressions x and y, x OR y matches the union of the Community attribute that are matched by x and those are matched by y. For example: The Community path '1 2 3 4 5' would be match by any one of the following regular expression: 1, 5, 4 3, 2 3 - 4*, 1 [3 4 2]+, not (6 7 8 9 10) and 1 2 Empty regular expression implies a match on all Community path.

mscVrIpBgpExportExpressPreference.name: mscVrIpBgpExportExpressPreference
mscVrIpBgpExportExpressPreference.description: This attribute specifies the relative preference of the policy which use the keys expressAsPath and expressCommunity. This attribute is ignored if attributes expressAsPath and expressCommunity are both empty. This attribute is used to break the tie when two export policies' expression attributes match a specific AS Path or Community. A higher value indicates a more preferred policy.

mscVrIpBgpExportSendCommunity.name: mscVrIpBgpExportSendCommunity
mscVrIpBgpExportSendCommunity.description: This attribute indicates which community number this Export policy will send along with the Path Attribute. Refer to RFC 1997 for the detailed description of how this attribute may be used to pass additional information to BGP peers. If the value is set to 0, no community is added to the Community attribute.

mscVrIpBgpExportInsertDummyAs.name: mscVrIpBgpExportInsertDummyAs
mscVrIpBgpExportInsertDummyAs.description: This attribute specifies the AS number(s) to be inserted into the AS Path Attribute. The value is a seuence of AS number seperated by period(.). For example, if the value is 20.20.30, the AS numbers 20, 20 and 30 would be inserted at the end of the AS Path Attribute just before the local AS number.

mscVrIpBgpExportNetRowStatusTable.name: mscVrIpBgpExportNetRowStatusTable
mscVrIpBgpExportNetRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscVrIpBgpExportNet components.

mscVrIpBgpExportNetRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscVrIpBgpExportNet component.

mscVrIpBgpExportNetRowStatus.name: mscVrIpBgpExportNetRowStatus
mscVrIpBgpExportNetRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscVrIpBgpExportNet components. These components can be added and deleted.

mscVrIpBgpExportNetComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscVrIpBgpExportNetProvTable.description: This group contains the set of provisionable attributes for the Network component.

mscVrIpBgpExportNetPrefix.description: This attribute specifies the network prefix whose length is determined by the length attribute under the same Network component.

mscVrIpBgpExportNetLength.name: mscVrIpBgpExportNetLength
mscVrIpBgpExportNetLength.description: This attribute specifies the length of the network prefix.

mscVrIpBgpAsRowStatusTable.name: mscVrIpBgpAsRowStatusTable
mscVrIpBgpAsRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscVrIpBgpAs components.

mscVrIpBgpAsRowStatusEntry.name: mscVrIpBgpAsRowStatusEntry
mscVrIpBgpAsRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscVrIpBgpAs component.

mscVrIpBgpAsRowStatus.name: mscVrIpBgpAsRowStatus
mscVrIpBgpAsRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscVrIpBgpAs components. These components can be added and deleted.

mscVrIpBgpAsComponentName.name: mscVrIpBgpAsComponentName
mscVrIpBgpAsComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscVrIpBgpAsStorageType.name: mscVrIpBgpAsStorageType
mscVrIpBgpAsStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscVrIpBgpAs tables.

mscVrIpBgpAsIndex.name: mscVrIpBgpAsIndex
mscVrIpBgpAsIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscVrIpBgpAs tables.

mscVrIpBgpAsProvTable.name: mscVrIpBgpAsProvTable
mscVrIpBgpAsProvTable.description: This group contains the attributes associated to each autonomous system for this Bgp component instance.

mscVrIpBgpAsWeight.name: mscVrIpBgpAsWeight
mscVrIpBgpAsWeight.description: This attribute specifies the weight for an autonomous system. It allows users to prefer some ASes over others. It is used in route selection. Lowest weight is preferred. Setting the weight of an AS to 255 will make any route that traverses through that AS unpreferred.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateRowStatusTable.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateRowStatusTable
mscVrIpBgpAggregateRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscVrIpBgpAggregate components.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscVrIpBgpAggregate component.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateRowStatus.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateRowStatus
mscVrIpBgpAggregateRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscVrIpBgpAggregate components. These components can be added and deleted.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateComponentName.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateComponentName
mscVrIpBgpAggregateComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscVrIpBgpAggregateStorageType.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateStorageType
mscVrIpBgpAggregateStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscVrIpBgpAggregate tables.

mscVrIpBgpAggregatePrefixIndex.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregatePrefixIndex
mscVrIpBgpAggregatePrefixIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the mscVrIpBgpAggregate tables.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateLengthIndex.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateLengthIndex
mscVrIpBgpAggregateLengthIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the mscVrIpBgpAggregate tables.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscVrIpBgpAggregateNet components.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetRowStatusEntry.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetRowStatusEntry
mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscVrIpBgpAggregateNet component.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetRowStatus.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetRowStatus
mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscVrIpBgpAggregateNet components. These components can be added and deleted.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetComponentName.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetComponentName
mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetStorageType.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetStorageType
mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscVrIpBgpAggregateNet tables.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetIndex.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetIndex
mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscVrIpBgpAggregateNet tables.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetProvTable.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetProvTable
mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetProvTable.description: This group contains the set of provisionable attributes for the Network component.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetPrefix.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetPrefix
mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetPrefix.description: This attribute specifies the network prefix whose length is determined by the length attribute under the same Network component.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetLength.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetLength
mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetLength.description: This attribute specifies the length of the network prefix.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetProtocol.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetProtocol
mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetProtocol.description: This attribute specifies the IP protocols to which this route should belong.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetEgpAsId.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetEgpAsId
mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetEgpAsId.description: This attribute specifies an EGP autonomous system number. When this value is non-zero, the protocol attribute must be set to either egp or to all. And this more specific route will be advertised together with the aggregated route only if it is learned through egp and this attribute matches the EGP autonomous system number where the network is learned from. The default value 0 indicates that the EGP autonomous system number is not specified.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetBgpAsId.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetBgpAsId
mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetBgpAsId.description: This attribute specifies the BGP autonomous system number. When this value is non-zero, the protocol attribute must be set to either bgp or to all. And this more specific route will be advertised together with the aggregated route only if it is learned through BGP and this attribute matches the BGP autonomous system number where the network is learned from. The default value 0 indicates that the BGP autonomous system number is not specified.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetOspfTag.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetOspfTag
mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetOspfTag.description: This attribute specifies the OSPF tag. When this attribute is set to a value other than the default value FFFFFFFF in hex, the protocol attribute must be set to either ospf or to all. And this more specific route will be advertised together with the aggregated route only if its OSPF tag matches this value. The default tag value 4294967295 (FFFFFFFF in hex) indicates that the tag is not specified.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetRipInterface.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetRipInterface
mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetRipInterface.description: This attribute specifies a local RIP interface which should be equal to one of the IP addresses provisioned as a logicalIf component under IpPort. When this value is non-zero, the value of the protocol attribute must be either set to rip or to all. And this more specific route will be advertised together with the aggregated route only if it is learned through RIP and this RIP interface. The default value 0.0.0.0 indicates that the RIP interface is not specified.

mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetAction.name: mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetAction
mscVrIpBgpAggregateNetAction.description: This attribute specifies whether this network should be aggregated or advertised out.

mscVrIpBgpIndbRowStatusTable.name: mscVrIpBgpIndbRowStatusTable
mscVrIpBgpIndbRowStatusTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscVrIpBgpIndb components.

mscVrIpBgpIndbRowStatusEntry.name: mscVrIpBgpIndbRowStatusEntry
mscVrIpBgpIndbRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscVrIpBgpIndb component.

mscVrIpBgpIndbRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscVrIpBgpIndb components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

mscVrIpBgpIndbComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscVrIpBgpIndbPeerIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the mscVrIpBgpIndb tables.

mscVrIpBgpIndbOperTable.name: mscVrIpBgpIndbOperTable
mscVrIpBgpIndbOperTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This group contains all the operational attributes of the IndbEntry component.

mscVrIpBgpIndbOrigin.name: mscVrIpBgpIndbOrigin
mscVrIpBgpIndbOrigin.description: This attribute indicates the ultimate origin of the path information. A value of incomplete means this information is not available.

mscVrIpBgpIndbInLocaldb.name: mscVrIpBgpIndbInLocaldb
mscVrIpBgpIndbInLocaldb.description: This attribute indicates whether or not this route was chosen as the best BGP4 route.

mscVrIpBgpIndbNextHop.name: mscVrIpBgpIndbNextHop
mscVrIpBgpIndbNextHop.description: This attribute indicates the IP address of the border router that should be used as the next hop for the destination network.

mscVrIpBgpIndbLocalPreference.name: mscVrIpBgpIndbLocalPreference
mscVrIpBgpIndbLocalPreference.description: This attribute indicates our IBGP peer's degree of preference for an advertised route. A higher value indicates a more preferred route.

mscVrIpBgpIndbCalcLocalPref.name: mscVrIpBgpIndbCalcLocalPref

If this Bgp instance is not a Route Reflector, this attribute is blank.
